intro: Gnaphalium chlorolepis, commonly known as the greenleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flower heads that are often mistaken for individual flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Gnaphalium chlorolepis is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and delicate structure.
